column4: Toma - stupid question, but when you have a sound file loaded, how do you jump do a spot within the sound file?
like say I want to use my mouse to jump to 5 seconds
after the song starts
audacity is really cool
i must say
any other cool apps I dont know about?
what is hydrogen?
:P
too many apps, we need a coolubuntuapps.com or something
Trying to find a cool app in synaptic is painful
Just make one... ;p
If you do, it will certainly be integrated in the community...
I think under linux it would be appropriate to have those "you might also like" links... KDE, you might also like GNOME, iceWM etc... Get what I mean?
I use kubuntu with iceWM, works well even on lowmem PCs.
Both gnome and kde take about 30 seconds to start up and swap all the time on my pc... While iceWM doesn't even have perceivable loading time and is hell fast.
- well yeah icewm is pretty fast but i like Gnome :D
Just you wait, rich boy... xD
- im actually a FreeBSD guy so I know my unix, but Ubuntu i really really nice, setting it up was simple and everything is well thought out, GUI tools are sane and well planned.
Yeh, thought the same. I was redhat fan before, but now I <3 Ubuntu xD
The MacosX feel comes from gnomes taskbar... xDD
- true, Gnome is turning into Mac OS X lite lol
